TextView.android:contentDescription: Jellow has 9 central category buttons. Swipe with single finger to go to image below. Swipe with two fingers to switch page.

ImageView.android:contentDescription: The image shows a screenshot of the home page of Jellow. The home page contains a central grid of 9 icons called category buttons that are arranged in 3 rows and 3 columns. The 9 category buttons are “Greet and feel”, “Daily activities”, “Eating”, “Fin”, “Learning”, “People”, “Places, “Time and weather”, and “Help”. Below the category buttons are 3 navigation buttons of “Back”, “Home” and “keyboard” arranged in that order at the bottom of the home screen. On the right and left sides of the central category icons are 3 expressive icons each. To the left of the central grid are 3 expressive buttons of “Like”, “Yes” and “More” arranged from top to bottom in that order. To the right of the central grid, are the remaining 3 expressive buttons of “Don’t like”, “No” and “Less” arranged from top to bottom. On the top right corner of the home screen is visible a settings icon. In this image the central grid of 9 icons has been highlighted with all other buttons faded out. Swipe with two fingers to switch page
